latestVersion.termsOfAccess:
Project files like raw data, coding guidelines and questionnaires can now be directly downloaded from this site.
Please see also SSD's Farm Household Survey Database (http://ricestat.irri.org/fhsd/).
latestVersion.dataAccessPlace: All files for this project/study, except for the Project Description, need to be directly downloaded from SSD's Farm Household Survey Database's online link: http://ricestat.irri.org/fhsd/

dsDescriptionValue.value: This farm household survey is an activity under the socio-economic component of the project entitled "Managing Rice Landscapes in the Marginal Uplands for Household Food Security and Environmental Sustainability". The objective of the project is to improve food security of farming households in the marginal highlands through more efficient production over the rice landscape. The socio-economic component focuses on analyzing how various component technologies contribute to improving farmers' livelihoods. Specific objectives are: a)  to describe and understand existing farm practices and livelihoods in the marginal uplands; b) to identify possible points of intervention for improving productivity and food security and initiating income growth and c) to serves as a baseline for future impact assessment.

keywordValue.value: Land use, Production inputs, Income, Demographics.

fields.value: Subject: Number of Repondents  Type: Sample Size  Notes: 200;
